verses.kjv: Now the days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying,
verses.web: Now the days of David came near that he should die; and he commanded Solomon his son, saying,
verses.ct: As David's life was coming to an end, he gave these instructions to his son Solomon:

verses.kjv: I go the way of all the earth: be thou strong therefore, and shew thyself a man;
verses.web: “I am going the way of all the earth. You be strong therefore, and show yourself a man;
verses.ct: "I'm about to die, as everyone must. Be strong and prove yourself a man.

verses.kjv: And keep the charge of the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself:
verses.web: and keep the instruction of LORD your God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, his commandments, his ordinances, and his testimonies, according to that which is written in the law of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do, and wherever you turn yourself.
verses.ct: Obey the LORD your God. Walk in his ways and keep his statutes, commands, laws, and decrees as written in the Law of Moses. If you do, you'll succeed in everything you do and everywhere you go.

verses.kjv: That the LORD may continue his word which he spake concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.
verses.web: Then LORD may establish his word which he spoke concerning me, saying, ‘If your children are careful of their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail you,’ he said, ‘a man on the throne of Israel.’
verses.ct: Then the LORD will keep the promise he made to me: 'If your descendants are careful to live faithfully before me with all their heart and soul, you will always have a man on the throne of Israel.'

verses.kjv: Moreover thou knowest also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, and what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel, unto Abner the son of Ner, and unto Amasa the son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins, and in his shoes that were on his feet.
verses.web: “Moreover you know also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, even what he did to the two captains of the armies of Israel, to Abner the son of Ner, and to Amasa the son of Jether, whom he killed, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war on his sash that was around his waist, and in his sandals that were on his feet.
verses.ct: "You also know what Joab son of Zeruiah did to me — what he did to the two commanders of Israel's armies, Abner son of Ner and Amasa son of Jether. He murdered them in peacetime as if it were war, staining the belt around his waist and the sandals on his feet with innocent blood.

verses.kjv: Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to the grave in peace.
verses.web: Do therefore according to your wisdom, and don’t let his gray head go down to Sheol in peace.
verses.ct: Use your wisdom to deal with him, and don't let him die peacefully of old age.

verses.kjv: But shew kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.
verses.web: But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be among those who eat at your table; for so they came to me when I fled from Absalom your brother.
verses.ct: But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite and let them eat at your table, because they stood by me when I was fleeing from your brother Absalom.

verses.kjv: And, behold, thou hast with thee Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite of Bahurim, which cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at Jordan, and I sware to him by the LORD, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword.
verses.web: “Behold, there is with you Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim; but he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to him by LORD, saying, ‘I will not put you to death with the sword.’
verses.ct: "And there's Shimei son of Gera, the Benjamite from Bahurim. He cursed me viciously the day I went to Mahanaim. But when he came down to meet me at the Jordan, I swore to him by the LORD, 'I will not put you to death with the sword.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man, and knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but his hoar head bring thou down to the grave with blood.
verses.web: Now therefore don’t hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man; and you will know what you ought to do to him, and you shall bring his gray head down to Sheol with blood.”
verses.ct: But don't let him go unpunished. You're a wise man — you'll know what to do with him. Make sure his gray head goes down to the grave in blood."

verses.kjv: So David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.
verses.web: David slept with his fathers, and was buried in David’s city.
verses.ct: Then David died and was buried in the City of David.

verses.kjv: And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
verses.web: The days that David reigned over Israel were forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: David reigned over Israel for 40 years — 7 years in Hebron and 33 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then sat Solomon upon the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.
verses.web: Solomon sat on David his father’s throne; and his kingdom was firmly established.
verses.ct: Solomon took his place on his father David's throne, and his kingdom was firmly established.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.
verses.web: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. She said, “Do you come peaceably?” He said, “Peaceably.
verses.ct: Adonijah son of Haggith came to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother. She asked, "Do you come in peace?" He answered, "Yes, in peace."

verses.kjv: He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And she said, Say on.
verses.web: He said moreover, I have something to tell you.” She said, “Say on.”
verses.ct: Then he said, "I have something to ask you." She said, "Go ahead."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother’s: for it was his from the LORD.
verses.web: He said, “You know that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign. However the kingdom is turned around, and has become my brother’s; for it was his from LORD.
verses.ct: He said, "You know the kingdom was supposed to be mine. All Israel expected me to be king. But things turned out differently — the kingdom went to my brother because the LORD gave it to him.

verses.kjv: And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on.
verses.web: Now I ask one petition of you. Don’t deny me.” She said to him, “Say on.”
verses.ct: Now I have just one request. Please don't refuse me." She said, "Go on."

verses.kjv: And he said, Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon the king, (for he will not say thee nay,) that he give me Abishag the Shunammite to wife.
verses.web: He said, “Please speak to Solomon the king (for he will not tell you ‘no’), that he give me Abishag the Shunammite as wife.”
verses.ct: He said, "Please ask King Solomon — he won't refuse you — to give me Abishag the Shunammite as my wife."

verses.kjv: And Bathsheba said, Well; I will speak for thee unto the king.
verses.web: Bathsheba said, “All right. I will speak for you to the king.”
verses.ct: Bathsheba replied, "All right. I'll speak to the king for you."

verses.kjv: Bathsheba therefore went unto king Solomon, to speak unto him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for the king’s mother; and she sat on his right hand.
verses.web: Bathsheba therefore went to king Solomon, to speak to him for Adonijah. The king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself to her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a throne to be set for the king’s mother; and she sat on his right hand.
verses.ct: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak on Adonijah's behalf. The king stood up to greet her, bowed to her, and sat down on his throne. He had a throne placed for his mother, and she sat at his right hand.

verses.kjv: Then she said, I desire one small petition of thee; I pray thee, say me not nay. And the king said unto her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not say thee nay.
verses.web: Then she said, “I ask one small petition of you; don’t deny me.” The king said to her, “Ask on, my mother; for I will not deny you.”
verses.ct: She said, "I have one small request. Please don't refuse me." The king replied, "Ask away, Mother. I won't refuse you."

verses.kjv: And she said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy brother to wife.
verses.web: She said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as wife.”
verses.ct: She said, "Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as his wife."

verses.kjv: And king Solomon answered and said unto his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for him the kingdom also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.
verses.web: King Solomon answered his mother, “Why do you ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask for him the kingdom also; for he is my elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.”
verses.ct: King Solomon answered his mother, "Why are you asking for Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? You might as well ask for the kingdom for him too! He's my older brother, and he has Abiathar the priest and Joab son of Zeruiah on his side."

verses.kjv: Then king Solomon sware by the LORD, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah have not spoken this word against his own life.
verses.web: Then king Solomon swore by LORD, saying, “God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah has not spoken this word against his own life.
verses.ct: Then King Solomon swore by the LORD: "May God strike me dead and worse if Adonijah hasn't sealed his own fate by making this request.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, as the LORD liveth, which hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who hath made me an house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this day.
verses.web: Now therefore as LORD lives, who has established me, and set me on my father David’s throne, and who has made me a house as he promised, surely Adonijah shall be put to death today.”
verses.ct: As surely as the LORD lives — the one who established me, placed me on my father David's throne, and built me a dynasty as he promised — Adonijah will be put to death today."

verses.kjv: And king Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died.
verses.web: King Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell on him, so that he died.
verses.ct: King Solomon sent Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and he struck Adonijah down, and he died.

verses.kjv: And unto Abiathar the priest said the king, Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou art worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou barest the ark of the LORD God before David my father, and because thou hast been afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted.
verses.web: To Abiathar the priest the king said, “Go to Anathoth, to your own fields; for you are worthy of death. But I will not at this time put you to death, because you bore the Lord LORD’s ark before David my father, and because you were afflicted in all in which my father was afflicted.”
verses.ct: To Abiathar the priest, the king said, "Go back to your fields in Anathoth. You deserve to die, but I won't execute you right now because you carried the ark of the Lord GOD before my father David and because you shared in all my father's hardships."

verses.kjv: So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priest unto the LORD; that he might fulfil the word of the LORD, which he spake concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
verses.web: So Solomon thrust Abiathar out from being priest to LORD, that he might fulfill LORD’s word, which he spoke concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
verses.ct: So Solomon removed Abiathar from serving as priest of the LORD, fulfilling the word the LORD had spoken against the house of Eli in Shiloh.

verses.kjv: Then tidings came to Joab: for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
verses.web: This news came to Joab; for Joab had followed Adonijah, although he didn’t follow Absalom. Joab fled to LORD’s Tent, and held onto the horns of the altar.
verses.ct: When news of all this reached Joab — who had supported Adonijah, though he had not supported Absalom — Joab fled to the tent of the LORD and grabbed hold of the horns of the altar.

verses.kjv: And it was told king Solomon that Joab was fled unto the tabernacle of the LORD; and, behold, he is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.
verses.web: King Solomon was told, “Joab has fled to LORD’s Tent, and behold, he is by the altar.” Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go, fall on him.”
verses.ct: When King Solomon was told that Joab had fled to the tent of the LORD and was clinging to the altar, he sent Benaiah son of Jehoiada with orders: "Go, strike him down."

verses.kjv: And Benaiah came to the tabernacle of the LORD, and said unto him, Thus saith the king, Come forth. And he said, Nay; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.
verses.web: Benaiah came to LORD’s Tent, and said to him, “The king says, ‘Come out!’ ” He said, “No; but I will die here.” Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, “This is what Joab said, and this is how he answered me.”
verses.ct: Benaiah went to the tent of the LORD and said to Joab, "The king says, 'Come out.'" But Joab replied, "No — I will die here." Benaiah reported back to the king: "This is what Joab said, and this is how he answered me."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the innocent blood, which Joab shed, from me, and from the house of my father.
verses.web: The king said to him, “Do as he has said, and fall on him, and bury him; that you may take away the blood, which Joab shed without cause, from me and from my father’s house.
verses.ct: The king told him, "Do as he says — strike him down and bury him. This will remove from me and my father's house the guilt of the innocent blood that Joab shed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with the sword, my father David not knowing thereof, to wit, Abner the son of Ner, captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the host of Judah.
verses.web: LORD will return his blood on his own head, because he fell on two men more righteous and better than he, and killed them with the sword, and my father David didn’t know it: Abner the son of Ner, captain of the army of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the army of Judah.
verses.ct: The LORD will bring his bloodshed back on his own head, because he struck down two men who were more righteous and better than he — Abner son of Ner, commander of Israel's army, and Amasa son of Jether, commander of Judah's army — killing them with the sword without my father David's knowledge.

verses.kjv: Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of his seed for ever: but upon David, and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace for ever from the LORD.
verses.web: So their blood will return on the head of Joab, and on the head of his offspring forever. But for David, for his offspring, for his house, and for his throne, there will be peace forever from LORD.”
verses.ct: Their blood will be on Joab's head and on his descendants forever. But for David, his descendants, his house, and his throne, there will be peace from the LORD forever."

verses.kjv: So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and slew him: and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
verses.web: Then Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up and fell on him, and killed him; and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
verses.ct: So Benaiah son of Jehoiada went and struck Joab down and killed him. He was buried at his home in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the host: and Zadok the priest did the king put in the room of Abiathar.
verses.web: The king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his place over the army; and the king put Zadok the priest in the place of Abiathar.
verses.ct: The king appointed Benaiah son of Jehoiada as commander of the army in Joab's place, and he appointed Zadok as priest in place of Abiathar.

verses.kjv: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Build thee an house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither.
verses.web: The king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, “Build yourself a house in Jerusalem, and live there, and don’t go anywhere else.
verses.ct: Then the king summoned Shimei and told him, "Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and live there. Don't leave the city for any reason.

verses.kjv: For it shall be, that on the day thou goest out, and passest over the brook Kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thine own head.
verses.web: For on the day you go out and pass over the brook Kidron, know for certain that you will surely die. Your blood will be on your own head.”
verses.ct: The day you leave and cross the Kidron Valley, know for certain that you will die. Your blood will be on your own head."

verses.kjv: And Shimei said unto the king, The saying is good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.
verses.web: Shimei said to the king, “What you say is good. As my lord the king has said, so will your servant do.” Shimei lived in Jerusalem many days.
verses.ct: Shimei replied, "That's fair. Your servant will do as my lord the king has said." And Shimei lived in Jerusalem for a long time.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish son of Maachah king of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying, Behold, thy servants be in Gath.
verses.web: At the end of three years, two of Shimei’s slaves ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. They told Shimei, saying, “Behold, your slaves are in Gath.”
verses.ct: But 3 years later, two of Shimei's slaves ran away to Achish son of Maachah, king of Gath. When Shimei was told, "Your slaves are in Gath,"

verses.kjv: And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants: and Shimei went, and brought his servants from Gath.
verses.web: Shimei arose, saddled his donkey, and went to Gath to Achish, to seek his slaves; and Shimei went, and brought his slaves from Gath.
verses.ct: he saddled his donkey and went to Gath, to Achish, to get his slaves back. He found them and brought them home from Gath.

verses.kjv: And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come again.
verses.web: Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and had come again.
verses.ct: When Solomon was told that Shimei had left Jerusalem and gone to Gath and returned,

verses.kjv: And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said unto him, Did I not make thee to swear by the LORD, and protested unto thee, saying, Know for a certain, on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, that thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me, The word that I have heard is good.
verses.web: The king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, “Didn’t I adjure you by LORD, and warn you, saying, ‘Know for certain, that on the day you go out, and walk anywhere else, you shall surely die?’ You said to me, ‘The saying that I have heard is good.’
verses.ct: the king summoned Shimei and said, "Didn't I make you swear by the LORD and warn you clearly, 'The day you leave and go anywhere, know for certain that you will die'? And you told me, 'That's fair. I agree.'

verses.kjv: Why then hast thou not kept the oath of the LORD, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?
verses.web: Why then have you not kept the oath of LORD, and the commandment that I have instructed you with?”
verses.ct: So why didn't you keep the oath you swore before the LORD and the command I gave you?"

verses.kjv: The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all the wickedness which thine heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore the LORD shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head;
verses.web: The king said moreover to Shimei, “You know in your heart all the wickedness that you did to David my father. Therefore LORD will return your wickedness on your own head.
verses.ct: The king also said to Shimei, "You know in your heart all the evil you did to my father David. Now the LORD is bringing your wickedness back on your own head.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the LORD for ever.
verses.web: But king Solomon will be blessed, and David’s throne will be established before LORD forever.”
verses.ct: But King Solomon will be blessed, and David's throne will be established before the LORD forever."

verses.kjv: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; which went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
verses.web: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he went out, and fell on him, so that he died. The kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
verses.ct: Then the king gave the order to Benaiah son of Jehoiada. He went out and struck Shimei down, and he died. And so the kingdom was firmly established in Solomon's hands.
